chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Jon Sobolik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to COCC within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay will be a judgment.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to the COCC within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay will be a judgment.

Subject to good time and work release.
**Defendant may serve time in Goodhue County, Minnesota as long as it is at no cost to Polk County.**
***Per Court Order on 4/25/2018, sentence credit modified to 135 days.***

Must provide DNA sample.
Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, may not possess body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

Defendant may request expungement of the DNA sample under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4) by petitioning the Wisconsin Department of Justice. Expungement of DNA is NOT a court process. 
For information see: http://www.doj.state.wi.us/dles/crime-labs/clb-forms.  Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion.  Not to commit any new crimes.  Defendant shall give written notice to the Clerk of this Court within 48 hours of any changes of address or telephone number.
